intro: Thelypodium streptanthoides, commonly known as the slender bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by elongated, inflated pods. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
